name: places/ChIJF-9Nhe9YwokRP5rQjiQpagw

displayName.text: New York Spine Institute: De Moura Alexandre MD

formattedAddress: 521 Park Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 521 Park Ave, New York, NY 10065-8140, USA

originalText.text: I went to Dr. D for my back pain back in 2011 I believe, he was charming, and explained and answered all my questions, staff as well very professional. Had my fist surgery and after 8 months and  PT 3X a week the pain became more and more crucial. I went back and I told him that something was wrong...I wanted an MRI to see what was wrong (;was a critical care nurse For 20 years) anyway it turns out there was a shadow showing where the screws were...blah blah was told I needed another surgery, again this time 8-10 months later the same thing and Yes the MRI showed Exactly the same thing. I knew at this point I had to seek out a new surgeon. Had Dr. Demoura truly examines and read the MRI report He would have known that the screws that were suppose to adhere to the bones were NOT THERE or very little bone was seen. It doesn’t take much to properly take the time and ask yourself WHY or What can be done the 2nd time around to make this work and get his patient out of pain.  I sought out a new MD and he ordered new scans and back to the OR we went but this time I was given a bone graft before the real surgery occurred . It took 2 more surgeries to FINALLY GET ME OUT OF PAIN and correct the mess that DR. D did to my spine.  SO ...with that said ..be very picky on who you choose to do your surgery and see if you can start out doing what they call a NANO procedure ( its what the docs do to other docs) found this out too late. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY from DR D. !!!!
